text: Polylepis tomentella, known in its native habitat by the Spanish common name queñoa de altura (polylepis or quenoa of [high] altitude), is a short tree or shrub which is found in small, scattered groupings along the mountainous borders of Bolivia, Chile, and Peru (Western Cordillera), growing in soil formed by volcanoes. Populations may also be present in Argentina, but this is unconfirmed. ==Sources== tarapacana Category:Trees of Bolivia Category:Trees of Chile Category:Trees of Peru Category:Páramo flora Category:Near threatened flora of South America Category:Plants described in 1891 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Polylepis tomentella
